Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, insect pro-rich peptide analog, ainmal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.44%) toOvispirinI: 28%; R: 17%; K: 22%.Activity: active against 9 strains P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.26-27.8 ug/ml), 5 strains S. maltophilia (MIC 0.32-1.75 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 2.4 ug/ml), and S. aureus 930918 (MIC 3.3 ug/ml).Toxicity: human RBC: 10% hemolysis at 80 ug/ml (low hemo.lytic HC50 > 80 ug/ml).Structure:  CD: helical in TFE, LPS, and LTA. NMR: C-terminal helical (shorter than ovispirin-1) in TFE.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Sawai MV, Waring AJ, Kearney WR, McCray PB Jr, Forsyth WR, Lehrer RI, Tack BF. 2002
Literature Information.Title: Impact of single-residue mutations on the structure and function of ovispirin/novispirin antimicrobial peptides
